attributes.action: reduce the estimated £9bn cost of the 2012 olympic games and distribute the funds to areas we care about.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The proposed £9bn cost of the forthcoming olympics games is a disgrace to, I suspect, the majority of tax paying people who would rather see the money spent on a multitude of worthwhile and life changing issues instead. Hospitals, Air Ambulances, RNLI, crime prevention, cancer research, prevention of child abuse, prevention of animal abuse, education, road safety etc etc etc have to be better areas of spending than games that most of us will neither attend nor see any benefit from the facilities at all. Please sign this petition to reduce the huge expenditure and see the money spent on areas which can make a lasting difference, not just for a few weeks.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/2012budget/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
